snippet: Instead of sparking reform of Pakistan's health sector, a recent scandal over counterfeit heart medication has become an opportunity for political mudslinging.
abstract: Instead of sparking reform of Pakistan's health sector, a recent scandal over counterfeit heart medication has become an opportunity for political mudslinging.
lead_paragraph: KARACHI -- People across Pakistan are thinking twice before taking medication after the recent deaths of more than 120 patients who were prescribed contaminated heart medication at the Punjab Institute of Cardiology (P.I.C.), a leading government facility in Lahore. The drugs were laced with lethal quantities of an antimalarial drug and administered in excessive doses.
